definitions.definition: To draw or let out wholly; to drain completely.
examples: The water was exhausted out of the well.
Moisture of the earth is exhausted by evaporation.

definitions.definition: To empty by drawing or letting out the contents .
To use up ; to deplete , drain or expend wholly, or use until the supply comes to an end.
examples: My grandfather seemingly never exhausts his supply of bad jokes.
I exhausted my strength walking up the hill.

definitions.definition: To tire out ; to wear out ; to cause to be without any energy .

examples: That subject has already been exhausted .

definitions.definition: To subject to the action of various solvents in order to remove all soluble substances or extractives.
examples: to exhaust a drug successively with water, alcohol, and ether

main_definition: ( transitive ) To draw or let out wholly; to drain completely.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To empty by drawing or letting out the contents .
( transitive , literally , figuratively ) To use up ; to deplete , drain or expend wholly, or use until the supply comes to an end.
( transitive ) To tire out ; to wear out ; to cause to be without any energy .
( transitive ) To discuss thoroughly or completely.
( transitive , chemistry ) To subject to the action of various solvents in order to remove all soluble substances or extractives.
( intransitive ) To discharge or escape (as exhaust ).
